Posts.Content: Jun 7, 2008 01:56PM julie49 wrote: Hi Ekenny, Just found this board today myself (dx'd 2 months ago).  I'm Stage IV with mets to the bones all over my spine, sternum, ribs, pelvis, etc.  Was diagnosed by accident after a rib fracture that wouldn't heal, in spite of normal mammo 7 mos ago.  Have a daughter 5 and a son 11.  My onc told me he's seen lots of people do great with this diagnosis for 12-15 years, and I just figure that within that time, we're going to figure out a way to really beat it.  In the meantime, I'll fight like hell! :-)  It is very overwhelming, though, I know, to have to cope with the reality and find all the support you need.  It definitely seems to be out there, though!  I'm glad to have found this site...am trying not to feel discouraged about the lack of Stage-IV folks, LOL!!  I am 49, feel 36, very active, employed, taking Tamoxifen and pain pills...living to the fullest and going to do everything I can to be here to encourage others long down the road!  Hang in there.  (The success stories I've just read since your post are incredible!!) Julie J in Oregon Dx 4/6/08, Stage IV mets/bone ER+, PR+, Her-2-
Posts.Title: needing some hope ekenny315 Maryiz
